intro: Galium kitaibelianum, commonly known as Kitaibel's bedstraw, is a low-growing herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of flowering plants. The plant typically features slender, sprawling stems with opposite, heart-shaped leaves. Its small white or pink flowers appear in clusters and bloom in late spring to early summer. Galium kitaibelianum is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and stream banks.
